author: pulp1559
content: many thanks for the reply. followup question about partial withdrawals, if the call to the Withdrawals contract goes through (i.e enough fee + valid pubkey + called by validator owner) is it safe to assume the withdrawal ** will ** happen at some point in the future?

author: lucassaldanhaconsensys
content:
Not a guarantee. If the transaction goes through it is guaranteed the request will be sent to the consensus layer. But there are other business rules on the consensus side that have to be met to check a withdrawal request is valid. Once the request is received by the CL, this is what happens:
1. first the request will be processed and, if deemed valid, a partial withdrawal will be added to the queue of pending withdrawals;
2. When processing withdrawals from the queue, some other checks are performed and; if everything is fine; the withdrawal is actually "applied";

Some references from the consensus spec side:
- [process_withdrawal_request](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#new-process_withdrawal_request) 
- [get_expected_withdrawals](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#modified-get_expected_withdrawals)
- [process_withdrawals](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/electra/beacon-chain.md#new-process_withdrawal_request)
